direction.raw_text: Yeah, sorry. He stands, loving the view, forgetting why he is here. She waits it out as long as she can, not sure how she feels about this adoring look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was there something you..?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh, yeah.. Help!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm up to my ears with this funeral and I thought, you know, we haven't had time to talk much lately so maybe you'd like to come over and rip open envelopes with me and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry, I have lessons all afternoon. I have to get back in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, okay, I just..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry. She slips back inside. Frank stares at the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MATTIE`S HOUSE - CONTINUOUS 88 Mattie leans against the door with her eyes closed. There is no student at the piano.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CHURCH/SOUTHERN ILLINOIS - AFTERNOON 91 The hearse is parked in front of a beautiful white board church.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HEARSE - AFTERNOON 91A Close on Bush and Buddy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't say nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To who?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can say "hi". Bush gets out. Buddy sighs, mimes "Hi" and gets out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ILLINOIS CHURCH ENTRY - AFTERNOON 92 Buddy quietly creeps in through the front door, looks back over his shoulder, scowls, and enters the church.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He stops and looks around, awed by the beautifully serene 93 sanctuary. Now he sees a tall BLACK MAN (70) come out of an office door behind the pulpit, walk up the aisle, glancing out the window at the driveway, and then at Buddy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello. Buddy is out of words that he is allowed to say. He glances at the door but Bush is not coming in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi. Charlie holds out his hand, Buddy shakes it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you sure you're in the right place? Not expecting a funeral. Suddenly Bush steps into the church. Charlie squints over then stares at Bush with utter disbelief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Felix?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Charlie. They shake hands, then hug. Buddy is blown away that Bush would hug anyone. Bush looks up at the church rafters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Still standing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. Charlie give Bush a look then holds out his hand to Buddy again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Reverend Charlie Jackson.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's Buddy Robinson, he don't talk much.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Someone better talk. A ghost pulls up in the driveway in a hearse, you expect a little bit of a story.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CHURCH - LATER 94 Bush, Buddy and Charlie, sit in pews near a lovely altar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My hearing is not what it was. It sounded like you said you want me to preach at your funeral party with you sitting there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shaking his head) You know I've talked to God a lot about you over the years and he said he broke the mould when he made you. Said you were sure entertaining to watch but way too much trouble. Buddy grins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What would you want me to say at this funeral?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whatever you want to, Charlie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Could you give us a minute? Buddy starts to get up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sit still. Buddy plops back down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the matter? You scared to be alone with me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He can hear what's said. Buddy is surprised again. So is Charlie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right. After you left here.. did you do the right thing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Felix looks up at the beautifully crafted pulpit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I did.. what I thought was right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You confessed? Asked forgiveness? Bush looks off and the muscles jump in his jaw.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you tell her, Felix? Charlie sighs, leans on his knees, and drops his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You came a long way for nothing then. Bush's eyes jerk back to Charlie and they are hot. Buddy tenses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You self-righteous..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you dare..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I built my own jail and put myself in it! And I stayed in it for 40 goddamn years! No wife, no kids, no friends! That's not enough?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know it isn't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (tears welling up) Well. Why don't you come and say that then, Charlie? Hell, say it all! I don't care.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not on your life. The air is so heavy you can't breathe it. Bush suddenly gets up and leaves. Buddy starts to follow. Charlie puts his hand on him to stay. They sit in silence a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How much do you know about him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Almost nothing, sir. I just work at the funeral home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you know he built this church?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No?! (LOOKING AROUND) How's a man like him make something like this? I mean, I know he's a good carpenter but this is..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Magic? (off Buddy's look) Maybe it's the best of him, maybe he put his soul into it, I don't know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What ya'll were talking about.. what did he do? Who was he supposed to tell?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For him and God to know I guess. I wish I'd never been put between them, that's for sure. (BEAT) I will tell you that he showed up here half dead. I had just started preaching. Over the next 4 years we built this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you coming to the funeral? Charlie sighs and looks around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Omitted 94A 95 INT. HEARSE/MOVING/PMP - NIGHT 95 Buddy and Bush are both lost in thought. Finally..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I ask you something?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you have to?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. What are we doing? Since the day you came into the funeral home, I don't think anything has happened that you didn't want to happen. I just don't know where it's going.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a whole lot of things that you don't know. Like what a dog dreams. You can make up a story about him chasing rabbits but you don't know if there's rabbits in there or not. And he can't tell you, can he?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not unless he's a very special dog. They snort together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: People don't say what they mean either so you don't really know any more about them then you do about that dog's dream.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But what..?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That time you left my house I saw you stop and look back. You wanted to know what could make somebody like me. (off Buddy's uneasy look) Well here you are, son, here you are.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FUNERAL HOME - EVENING 9 6 Frank is putting money into a casket. He checks his watch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are you..? Lighting flashes and the lights suddenly go out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .OUTSIDE OF TOWN - NIGHT 97 The hearse creeps down the road
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .HEARSE - NIGHT 9 8 Buddy looks tired. Bush is sitting up ramrod straight, thinking hard about something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I better stop and tell Frank we're back. He's probably had 2 or 3 hissy fits by now. (looks out at the rain) Why don't you stay the night at the house and I'll take you home in the morning? The simple kindness seems to short Bush out. Buddy doesn't notice, he's still looking ahead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I... I ain't stayed with nobody in a.. in a long while.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's fine if you want to. Bush looks as if he might say yes but he NOTICES where the car is passing through and..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop the car. Bush starts to open the door. Buddy stops abruptly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't walk. It's too far.. Bush climbs out with his shotgun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Put the money in a casket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You might as well get back in, I'll follow you all the way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (snaps the gun closed) Get the hell out of here, boy! Buddy's eyes are defiant. Bush slams the door and walks away, crossing over a fence and out into a dark field.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not responsible. Not responsible. Shit. He slams the steering wheel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FUNERAL HOME - NIGHT 101 Buddy is putting the money into the foot of a casket. A lit candelabra sits nearby. There is NOISE, like the muted sound of something breaking. Buddy jerks and listens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Frank? Hello? Mr. Bush? He stuffs the money into the casket, grabs the candelabra, comes back, seals the lid, and starts into the office.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CEMETERY - NIGHT 102 Under the trees crooked rows of cold ghostly headstones glisten in the darkness. An old pocket lighter flares to reveal Bush staring at a pot of yellow flowers. He holds the lighter to a tombstone and brushes away the debris. It reads:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 1874 D. 1894. THUNDER rolls. Close on Bush's face as rain begins to fall..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They keep talking about forgiveness.. ask Jesus for forgiveness.. I never did nothing to Him..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FUNERAL HOME - NIGHT 106 Frank enters with a flashlight. He sees that his desk and files have been ransacked. He rushes into the casket room. Several caskets have been thrown to the floor. He goes to the one where the money is, finds that it is sealed tight, and sighs with relief. Hearing something he whips the light around and sees Buddy on the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FUNERAL HOME - NIGHT/LATER 107 Frank examines a cut and bump on top of Buddy's head by flashlight and dabs it gently with a cloth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The cut's not bad but how's the head? He moves his finger across Buddy's eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Follow it. He looks him over carefully. He's had experience.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dizzy? Double vision? Nauseous? (off Buddy's no) You'll be okay. Did you see who it was?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. I was putting the money in.. heard glass breaking.. locked up the casket quick and.. boom..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You did good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doesn't feel good. 108 INT. DARROW HOUSE/LIVING ROOM - LATER 108 Mattie sits beside a fire, knitting a baby blanket by an oil lamp. All at once the lights sputter on, the radio lights up, warms, and begins to PLAY, as a KNOCK at the door..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ./EXT. FRONT DOOR/DARROW HOUSE - CONTINUOUS 109 Mattie pulls the door open. Bush is standing there soaking wet, breathing hard, holding his shotgun. She draws back reflexively. He looks into her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please, Ma'am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DARROW HOUSE/BEDROOM - NIGHT 110 Bush stands with a towel around him, shivering. Mattie opens a dresser drawer. Inside the drawer, is the carefully arranged tableau of a watch, a ring, a stethoscope, and some clothes. She hates to disturb the drawer but pulls out a pair of black pants and a white shirt, lays them on the bed, and walks out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DARROW HOME/LIVING ROOM - NIGHT 111 Mattie steps from the kitchen with a steaming mug as Bush comes down the stairs in clothes that are too loose. Still shivering, Bush steps uneasily in front of the fire. Mattie hands him the hot mug. He looks uneasily at the yellow flowers on the table nearby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing here? Burned through, a log falls in the fire. Bush jerks oddly and moves away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I sit a minute? She stares at him then nods at a chair. She keeps standing behind the other chair. He bends over the mug and seems to lock up inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want to know why I have your sister's picture on my wall?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not stupid, Felix. No, I take that back. How long was it going on? She was already married when I met you. Were you just making up to me to get to her? Bush is so still he looks like a gargoyle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you're not going to talk, leave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you help who you love? Mattie's face tells us that she has asked herself that question many times.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've had 40 years to think about it and I still don't know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know either, so.. Slowly the gargoyle unfolds. His eyes drill into her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to tell you how it was. If you don't want me to, I'll go. Mattie sighs from down deep in her shoes then comes around and sits down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't lie to me. When did you take up with her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I came to see you and she was there, hanging clothes on the line with your mama. Bush stares out the window so hard, Mattie turns to see what he is looking at..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She turned around.. (as Mattie turns back) .and.. I promise you that I did not know that I had a heart till right then.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Tears well up in Mattie's eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You were a fine fine girl. I didn't know why you wanted anything to do with me but I was gonna keep coming to see you 'till my luck ran out. (BEAT) And then I saw her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She was married! And she wasn't just my sister, she was my best friend. We told each other everything. I can't.. how long did it go on?! Bush's face is so white it looks like a death mask.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How long?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's still going on, Little Bit. Mattie tries to absorb that. The truth and tragedy of it touches her in way that she is not prepared for. They sit there in silence. She suddenly wipes her face and scowls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you have anything to do with her death? The mug trembles. She sees it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell me. Like a fish jerked from the water, he mouth opens and closes, but nothing comes out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Felix! (off his haunted silence) Get out of my house! NOW! Bush stands up quickly and starts for the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And go to hell!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Been there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He staggers, tries to catch himself but slides down against the wall. Despite her anger, Mattie starts toward him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DARROW HOME/LIVING ROOM - NIGHT/MOMENTS LATER 112 Bush sits on the floor, pale as moonlight. Mattie is beside him with a stethoscope in her lap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You need to see a doctor.. He raises his eyes to her but says nothing. They look into each other for a long moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just tell me, Felix. Did you hurt Mary or not? Bush stares into her then suddenly gets up, picks up his shotgun and goes out the door without a word.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FUNERAL HOME/FRONT DOOR - NIGHT 113 Frank is putting the files back in the drawers when he hears a NOISE. He reaches into the drawer and turns with a pistol in his hand. Bush is standing in the doorway with his shotgun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell?! Bush glances at the pistol, at the open drawers of the cabinet and desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They get it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Buddy sealed it up in a casket. Took a crack on the head, but..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cold dark look) Is he all right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You sure?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was an army medic. He'll be fine. But Bush is still dark.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you ought to take those clothes back and get something in your size.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They get the whiskey?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FUNERAL HOME/OFFICE - NIGHT/LATER 114 Frank sits with his feet on the desk. Bush sits across from him. They each have a cup of whiskey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brought the money back, huh? (off Bush's absent nod) Listen, I've been thinking.. What if we had the party at your place? People are going to want to see the land they're getting so..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, think about it, we could..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't know that I'm doing it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thinking to call it off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Damn well can if I want to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No no no, it's in motion!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If I say no, it's no. Send the money back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're killing me! I bought things, hired people.. promised money, everybody in town is hoping to..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I care about this town as much as they care about me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's what you said you wanted and I've busted my ass for you. So why don't you want it anymore? You owe me that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was the end of the line, tell it all, get out of jail party. But I guess I ain't got the goddamn guts to open my own mouth and I can't get nobody to talk for me so the hell with it. And to hell with me. Bush grabs his shotgun and goes. Frank sits, stunned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BUDDY'S HOUSE-EARLY MORNING 115 Buddy sits at the breakfast table, holding his son. He opens and closes his eyes, checking out his vision. Kathryn, at the stove, sees him out of the corner of her eye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you having trouble seeing? BUDDY I see you're mad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not mad. I'm concerned She shoves the skillet off the burner and comes to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, you're mad. She tenderly touches his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If I could get my hands on whoever did this, you'd see mad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Buddy! You up?! Frank rushes in, lifts a phantom hat to Kathryn, scrapes up a chair, pulls on the baby's toe, and looks at Buddy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trouble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the matter?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bush is pulling out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened yesterday?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told you, we went up to Illinois and met a preacher.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But what happened?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He asked the preacher to come to the funeral. He said no.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Son of a bitch, that's got to be.. (TO KATHRYN) Sorry. (to the baby) Sorry. Where's the preacher?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It won't do you any good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why not?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He knows something about Bush, something bad, I think.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wouldn't say but..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well if Bush wants him, by God, Bush is gonna get him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (slams the skillet down) You want eggs, Frank, or will the skillet do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? What's wrong?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's wrong? My husband has his head bashed in and all you care about is this party!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not like that, Katie, this is for all of us. You're like.. family to me.. I..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is not how family acts!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I'm sorry. I've never had any practice. (gets up/to Buddy) You okay? Buddy nods. Frank leaves. Buddy mutters to the baby.. BUDDY Stay out of her way today, partner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MATTIE'S HOUSE - MORNING 11 6 Mattie is on her knees trying to plant bulbs in the hard cold ground. Her trowel barely gouges the earth. She stabs it again and again into the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fool, it's too late for bulbs..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Suddenly she hurls the trowel as far as she can, then a handful of bulbs.. then her hat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .too goddamn late..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FUNERAL HOME/OFFICE - DAY 117 Buddy is surrounded by bags. He is copying down names onto raffle tickets and putting them in bin for the drawing. There is a MAN standing guard by the front door with a rifle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BUSH'S BARN - DAY 118 Mule stands with his ears back, upset. Bush, back in his old clothes, is angrily planing a board. The box of his casket minus the lid is on sawhorses behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CHARLIE'S HOUSE/SOUTHERN ILLINOIS- LATE DAY 120 A blurred image becomes clear as a magnifying glass lowers to a page of a stamp collection book. Fingers fill an empty space with a prized addition. A LOUD KNOCKING startles him and the stamp is placed slightly crooked.. Reveal Charlie Jackson scowling at the crooked stamp. He gets up, does a double-take out the window. MORE LOUD KNOCKING.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CHARLIE'S HOUSE - LATE DAY 121 Charlie opens the door, sees Frank standing there. The hearse is parked outside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Reverend Jackson? (Charlie looks at hearse) Frank Quinn, Quinn funeral home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How'd you find me? Frank just smiles, takes off his hat, and offers his hand. Charlie gives him a long look and reluctantly motions him in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Frank enters, noting the clean simple home of man with an orderly mind. Charlie motions for Frank to sit down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was going to play some dominos this afternoon. But something told me to stay home. I should have played dominos. Is he out there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bush? No, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You sure?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pretty sure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you check the back? Frank snorts, liking Charlie immediately.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You told Bush that you wouldn't come to the funeral?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If he got that, why are you here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To help you rethink it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't need any help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you rethought it? (off Charlie's look) So there is a need. (BEAT) First off, Bush doesn't know I'm here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wouldn't be so sure about that. (off Frank's look) He's got a way of making people do what he wants them to. Frank squirms, knows it true.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is he really a hermit? Frank whistles and takes Bush's poster out of his coat. Charlie jerks at the picture of the wild man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He came to see me after he'd been here, wants to call the party off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't care.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Said he'd meant it to be a.. end of the line, tell it all, get out of jail funeral but that he didn't have the guts to open his mouth and he couldn't get anybody to talk for him. You know anything about that part? (off Charlie's sigh) At first he said he wanted everybody to come who had a story about him. But he didn't want to hear their bullshit stories, did he? Pardon my language. He wants to tell one, doesn't he?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: About time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whatever he did, it's been locked up in him for 40 years and he can't get it out. (off Charlie's look) I think he told you. You may be the only person he told. And now he wants you to tell it for him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because he won't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Or can't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Or won't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Or can't. (BEAT) At least he wants the truth to come out, give him that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll think about it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is there a boarding house around here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I said I'd think.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah but if you're not coming, I'm not going back. I made promises I can't keep to people I care about. This falls apart they won't blame Bush. Bank will take my business.. If I'm gonna have to start over again, might as well be from here. Charlie scowls at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FUNERAL HOME - DAY 122 Using a tool, Buddy unseals the casket to put the new money in it and discovers that the rest of the money is gone? He can't believe it. He yanks back the casket bed lining..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BUSH'S BARN - DAY 126 Bush is sanding the beautiful lid of his casket. It is leaning against the wall and sawdust is drifting down all over him. He suddenly stops, rubs the wood tenderly, muscles up the heavy top to put it on the box and staggers back. It's not the weight, something is wrong. Sweat pops out on his forehead. He forces himself to the casket and drops the top down hard, staggers back against the loft ladder, slides down to the ground, and stares at the casket. Is this it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CROSS ROADS - DAY 127 The hearse sits on the side of the road. Road signs give the mileage to different destinations.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HEARSE - DAY 127A Frank is lying in the back of the hearse, his head propped up on an old suitcase. He sips from his flask and stares out the window, thinking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BUSH'S BARN - LATE DAY 128 Bush is still on the ground propped against the ladder. His eyes are closed and the fading light steals across his face that is as still as it can be. The sawdust makes him look almost wooden. A shadow crosses then comes closer. Buddy is sure he is dead but Bush's eyes open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing, sir?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Getting a suntan. Bush starts to get up then falls back against the ladder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you stuck?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have no goddamn idea how right you are, son. Buddy moves to help him up but Bush waves him off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll sit here a minute. Bush looks at the butterfly bandage on Buddy's head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're a pair, ain't we?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you sick?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just going through the motions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What does that mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's Alive and there's Dead. And there's a worst place in between them that I hope you never know nothing about. (DARKENING) Do you know who hurt you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sonsabitches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It doesn't matter. Listen. Frank went somewhere and the raffle money is gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You figure he took off with it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. I don't want to think that. But the money's not here and I don't know where it is. He said he'd call and he never did.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Buddy glances into the shadows and sees the casket looming on the sawhorses. He stares at it..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well.. what do you want to do? Buddy looks back at Bush.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't.. (realizing just then) I want to make this funeral for you if you want it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (a long look) Hell. Do it if you can. (BEAT) I guess for everyone like me, there's one like you, son. I about forgot that. Buddy holds out his hand to help Bush up but Bush forces himself up on his own and walks out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CHARLIE'S HOUSE/SOUTHERN ILLINOIS - EVENING 130 Charlie sits at his desk, staring blankly at his crooked stamp. Suddenly Fate in the form of Frank Quinn looms at the window. Charlie knows he is there but he won't look at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BUDDY'S HOUSE/BEDROOM- DAWN 131 Buddy, Kathryn, and the baby are sleeping soundly. There is a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Buddy sits up, grabs a baseball bat and falls back asleep. The scratching starts again. He opens his eyes, surprised to see the bat in his hand. He hears the scratching. He looks around, sees something at the window. He slides to the floor, crawls on his knees, and looks out. Frank is standing there, scratching on the screen. Behind him is Charlie, looking very unhappy about standing in the near dark in a small southern town, scratching on a screen. Buddy realizes what he is seeing and starts to smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BUDDY'S HOUSE - DAWN 132 Frank, Buddy, and Charlie are on the porch, watching the world come to life. Charlie looks as if he is hoping for some kind of sign from above.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm glad you decided to come, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Free will is not all that it's cracked up to be.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you take the money out of the casket?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why didn't you tell me?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I forgot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You forgot?! Where is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the hearse, under the floorboards. Charlie remembers that Frank said he wasn't coming back and gives him a look. Buddy is giving Frank the same look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? Nobody steals a hearse. Now all we got to do is take the Reverend here to Bush and..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I forgot to tell you, Mr. Bush already said he would do it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're shittin' me?! Charlie gets up and starts walking away..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where can I catch a train?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't leave you just got here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watch and learn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hold on..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's the station?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - BUSH'S LAND/ROAD - MORNING 133 A tractor pulling a trailer with a big old honking generator on it, a truck loaded with equipment and workers for the big event rumbles down a dirt road. The Quinn Funeral home hearse completes the unlikely parade.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BUSH'S SHACK - MORNING 134 Bush, dressed in his new suit, shirt, and shoes is a striking figure. The old hermit is gone. He looks into the mirror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MATTIE'S HOUSE - MORNING 135 Horton hold the car door open for Kathryn who is holding the baby and looking back puzzled at Mattie's house. Finally she sighs and gets into the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MATTIE'S HOUSE - MORNING 135A Mattie stands staring out the window. She is not going.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BUSH'S LAND/FIELD - MORNING 136 At the top of a wide clearing, a truck with a Circus Ad on the door is being set up to become a stage. The tractor and truck pull into the clearing and drive to the circus truck. The hearse pulls in and parks. Frank, Buddy, and Charlie climb out of the hearse, look around, and stand frozen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Trucks and cars are parked everywhere around the big clearing! Many PEOPLE have been here all night with fires, tents and lean-tos. Many MORE PEOPLE are arriving now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Expecting a crowd? Frank and Buddy give each other a look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Honestly? We don't have a clue about what's going to happen here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The big old honking generator is unloaded. Holes are dug. 10 foot poles are slid from the truck and huge speaker horns are attached. Speaker poles are pulled up and set into holes. Frank directs a gang of 6 KIDS who are selling raffle tickets making sure they know that he has his eyes on them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: arrives on the back of pick-up truck. The Generator kicks on belching smoke everywhere. Frank is yelling Whoa Whoa! Disaster in the making.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BUSH'S SHACK - DAY 140 Bush stands staring out the checkerboard window. He sees Charlie approaching and opens the door for him. Charlie climbs the steps, appraises the shack, and stares at Bush.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pretty nice jail. Charlie enters and looks around the little room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why did you change your mind? Charlie just looks at him, the unspoken words louder than any reason he could give.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do you want to do this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't. He gets a haunted look that catches Charlie off guard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm gonna try and tell it, Charlie, I really am. But if I can't get it done, would you do it? I want it said. Please, sir. Charlie sighs from down in his shoes and starts for the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell'em the box is in the barn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BUSH'S LAND/BACK ROAD - DAY 142 Carl's truck is half hidden off the road. Carl, Gary and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: get out of the truck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Carl tucks an old 45 in the back of his pants. Gary and Theman grab three gas cans off the truck, give one to Carl, and clamber down a deep gully and start up the other side. Tom peeks out from behind the big garbage barrels.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BUSH'S LAND/FIELD - DAY 143 The generator is working! And standing on the flat bed truck, which is now a stage, an ANNOUNCER introduces a hot blue grass group The crowd is huge now and listens as the group kicks off a song. Behind the stage Frank is collecting money from the boys who are selling the raffle tickets, making them turn their pockets inside out. The generator makes a strange noise, Frank eyeballs it, and it labors on. Buddy walks up, nudges Frank, and nods out at the huge crowd. Can you believe this?! Charlie walks up and says something that we cannot hear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BUSH'S SHACK - DAY 144 Pacing the cage, Bush peeks out the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You asked for it you old ornery sonofabitch, now what are you gonna do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BUSH'S BARN - DAY 145 Frank, Buddy, and Charlie enter the barn and see Mule hitched to the wagon. On the back of the wagon is a simple and rustically elegant casket with the initials FB carved into the center board. It sobers them all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BUSH'S LAND/GULLY - DAY 146 Carl, Gary, and Theman hide and watch Frank, Buddy and Charlie walk Mule and the wagon away from the barn and down the road. Carl eyes Bush's shack and starts for it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, hey, where you going? He said the woods..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Closer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . And he takes off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's crazy!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BUSH'S LAND/FIELD - DAY 149 The bluegrass fiddle player nods to the others to quickly end the song. Now we see why. Frank, Buddy, and Charlie have brought the wagon with the coffin into the field. Everyone quiets, remembering why they are here. They park the wagon behind the hearse. Frank and Charlie walk toward the stage. Buddy peels away. Frank calls after him to come with them to the stage but Buddy waves them away. He wants no part of that. He sees Kathryn and Horton threading their way through the crowd and moves toward them instead. Frank and Charlie climb the makeshift stairs up to the stage. Charlie sits down on a folding chair while Frank goes to the big microphone and stares with satisfaction at the huge Depression-era Woodstock crowd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good afternoon ladies and gentlemen. I'm Frank Quinn of Quinn Funeral Home. Welcome to the live funeral party of Mr. Felix Bush! People don't know whether to clap or not. Some do and the rest of them pick it up. Buddy gets to Kathryn and hugs her and the baby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's Mattie?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She wouldn't come. I don't..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've done some things in my life, but never this. Bet you haven't either, bet no one has. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (winks back at Charlie) We try to make things predictable and safe but if we don't risk everything to get what we want, we don't want it enough.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BUSH'S LAND/FIELD - CONTINUOUS 151 Frank finds Buddy in the crowd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The person who made all of this happen for us doesn't like the spotlight but Buddy Robinson is the heart of Quinn Funeral Home and I'm proud to know him. Buddy is embarrassed and moved. Kathryn's eyes soften.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BUSH'S SHACK - DAY 152 Carl is sloshing gasoline onto the back porch while Gary and Theman keep nervous watch at the farendof porch. Suddenly Carl feels a shotgun's cold metal on his neck and the 45 being ripped from his belt and thrown to the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sonsabitches. Carl drops his can. The other men drop their cans but Gary starts to pull a pistol from his back pocket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go on, I'll paint the porch with his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't do it! Gary drops the pistol.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now pick up them cans and keep pouring.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You heard me. The men cautiously pick up the cans..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pour it on your head. All of it. The men look at each other. Bush cocks the other barrel of his shotgun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I won't! BUSH Pour it or die, I don't care which. The men hoist the cans and start to pour the gasoline over them. Burning and spitting they empty the cans. Suddenly Theman bolts, moaning and running blind with gas in his eyes. BUSH I got two barrels, anybody else wants to rabbit, now's the time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BUSH'S LAND/FIELD - DAY 153 FRANK I know many of you have heard stories about Mr. Bush. But today I've been told that we're going to hear another kind of story, his. A murmuring moves in a wave across the crowd as they see.. .Bush enters the field with his shotgun pointed at Carl and Gary's backs. They are drenched with gas and it is burning them through their clothes. Buddy, Kathryn, and Horton see Bush. Quinn and Charlie follow the crowd's eyes to Bush.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holy Mother of..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: beside the stage see Bush. But everyone remains frozen, not knowing what has happened or what to do now. Is this the crazy Bush of the legends?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Buddy starts toward Bush. Kathryn tries to stop him but he pulls free and walks slowly toward Bush. A shot rings out!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Carl and Gary hit the ground like dead men. The crowd hunkers and scatters. Horton steps in front of Kathryn and the baby. Buddy freezes. Charlie rushes up beside Frank at the microphone. Carl rolls up and turns to Bush and sees blood seeping out onto his shirt beneath his coat. Bush whirls and sees.. .Carl's old 45 still smoking. The gun is in Tom's small shaking hands..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't hurt him! It's my fault.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .. Bush cracks his shotgun, walks slowly to the boy, gently takes the 45, empties the shells, and hands the gun back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A second chance is a precious thing, son. Don't waste it. The boy plops down, overwhelmed. And suddenly everyone is in motion. The Deputies run toward Bush. Frank and Charlie rush from the stage. Kathryn and Horton are going. Buddy arrives at Bush first and sees the blood weeping onto his shirt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you alright, sir?! Without turning Bush glances at the Deputies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tried to burn me out. Let the boy be, he didn't mean nothing. As the Deputies get a hold of Carl and Gary, Frank, Charlie, Kathryn and Horton arrive. Carl looks at Horton with pleading eyes and nods to Tom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Help him, Gus, please..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Horton goes to the trembling boy and picks him up. Bush suddenly walks into the trees without looking back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . WCGM RADIO STATION - DAY 153A The Announcer hangs up the phone on the wall, rushes to the turntable and lifts the tone arm from the record that is playing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Folks, I've just received word of a tragic turn of events at the Bush Funeral Party. It seems that Mr. Bush has been shot. I repeat, Mr. Felix Bush has been shot. There is no word of condition..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MATTIE'S HOUSE - DAY 153B The radio is playing but we don't know where Mattie is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) When I know more I will let you know. I'm sure he would appreciate your prayers..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BUSH'S SHACK - DAY 154 Bush stands at the mirror, his shirt unbuttoned and pulled back. The bullet caught the muscle just above his clavicle. Buddy, Frank and Charlie rush in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Close the door. Charlie slams the door. Frank examines the wound. Buddy stares in shock at the old roping burns scars on Bush's chest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Missed the bone. Got any alcohol and clean rags? Bush nods at the cabinet. Charlie finds an amazing assortment of herbs and roots, alcohol and old sheets ripped into rags.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why don't you sit down, sir?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boil some water and I'll tell you how to make me a poultice. Frank takes the rags and alcohol from Charlie
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is gonna hurt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't sugar coat it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BUSH'S LAND/FIELD - DAY 155 Everyone is standing around in shock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BUSH'S SHACK - DAY 156 Kathryn waits anxiously near the porch with the baby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BUSH'S LAND/FIELD - DAY 157 Horton steps up to the microphone. The shocked crowd turns to him. He closes his eyes and bows his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lord, you say you move in mysterious ways and we believe you because we don't understand much of anything. And so we come to you today not seeking answers to what's happened here but asking you to help us open our hearts a little more to each other and find some forgiveness and understanding.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BUSH'S SHACK - DAY 158 Frank has cleaned the wound. Buddy has made a poultice that Bush is pressing onto the wound as he hears the last of Horton's prayer over the loudspeakers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pretty good prayer. Mighta been wrong about that preacher.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why don't you lay down, Felix?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Bush thinks about it, sees a way out. For a second he looks like he might take it. Then he shakes his head, puts a rag over the poultice and pulls his shirt up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's go 'fore I lose my nerve.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you sure? Bush scowls at the huge blood stain on his shirt. He looks at Frank's white shirt. Frank just stares at him. Bush keeps looking. Finally Frank sighs and starts loosening his tie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BUSH'S LAND/FIELD - DAY 159 The bluegrass band sings a good hymn. The crowd is still stunned and talking, not knowing what to do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BUSH'S SHACK - DAY 160 Buddy gently helps Bush into his jacket, which has a bullet tear in it along the shoulder but Bush seems okay with it, to Frank's relief. Frank is putting on an old faded shirt of Bush's. As Bush starts for the door, he comes up beside Charlie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You ain't nervous? All them white folks out there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's white folks here?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stick with me, you'll be all right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're the one they're shooting at. As Charlie opens the door, Bush stops, all his misgivings flooding in with the light. He looks at Buddy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pretty interesting day so far, huh boy? Bush straightens himself up and goes out the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BUSH'S LAND/FIELD - DAY 161 Charlie, Bush walk through the murmuring parting crowd toward the stage. Frank and Buddy are close behind. Buddy is looking for Kathryn. She spots him and moves toward the stage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BUSH'S LAND/FIELD - DAY 162 Bush and Charlie go up the steps to the stage. At the last second, Bush stares at the big microphone and stops, unable to go on. Charlie gives him a look then goes on up to the microphone and looks out a the sea of white folks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm Reverend Charlie Jackson. Felix wants to continue with his funeral. And he's asked me to say a few words. Just below the stage, Buddy and Frank are joined by Kathryn. Charlie glances back at Bush, turns inward, searching for the words. Finally he holds his hands out, wide apart.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We like to imagine that good and bad, right and wrong, are miles apart. But the truth is, very often they're.. (brings his hand together and laces his fingers
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .all tangled up with each other. Bush raises his head and looks at Charlie's back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some 40 years ago Felix Bush dropped into my life and then dropped out. In between he built the most beautiful sanctuary that I've ever seen. A lot of wonderful things happened in that church. Suddenly Bush breaks away, moves up beside Charlie, and puts his hand on his shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you, Charlie. Thank you. Charlie gives him a long look then steps away from the microphone and moves back to where Bush was standing. Bush stares at the microphone, takes a breath, and walks up to it, and looks out over the huge crowd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Had to go clear to Illinois to find somebody that had anything good to say about me. Hell of a thing. His voice booms out over the crowd, startling him. He looks down, sees Buddy, Kathryn, Frank and Horton. He looks closer for someone most important but she is not there. The crowd murmurs. Finally..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not a smart man or a wise one. I don't know what kind of man I am. I was always restless, thought I'd see the world. But I didn't hardly go nowhere.. on purpose.. (BEAT) Because.. because I did something that I was ashamed of. Something I couldn't ever fix. (GLANCES AROUND) Ya'll probably think you know what you'd do or what you wouldn't. And I wish you good luck with that. I really do. (BEAT) When I told Charlie what I'd done, he told me to confess to God and the law and to.. to someone else.. so I could get forgiveness. But I didn't want forgiveness. (BEAT) I needed to hold on to what I did.. to be sick from it every day of my life. So I never told nobody else. He stops, not knowing how to go on. The crowd has quieted completely. As as his eyes sweep over the sea of expectant faces, he suddenly SEES HER coming through the crowd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Mattie's here. Seeing that Felix appears to alright, her face changes from conflicted concern to open unbridled hatred. The look takes Bush's breath away. But he suddenly seems to accept it as his due and when he talks, it is only to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I fell in love with a married lady. And somehow she fell in love with me. It was the only time that I have been in love. (GATHERS HIMSELF) We made a plan to run off and start a new life but she didn't show up at the time that we said we'd meet. I got a funny feeling and I went to her house. Buddy, Kathryn and Frank all see Mattie now, see Bush talking just to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her husband answered the door. (BEAT) He had blood on him. For Mattie all of this is like window into the past being suddenly thrown open and she is haunted and mesmerized.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hit him pretty hard, knocked him down. Can't remember going upstairs but I remember I saw a hammer on the steps and it had blood and hair on it. The crowd gasps. Mattie is trembling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I found her in the bedroom. She was crawling across the floor. (BEAT) But before I could get to her and help her up.. a kerosene lamp hit the wall. And then her husband jumped on my back. Funny what happens sometimes when things go wrong. It's like the clock stops and you have all the time in the world to think. I could see that her husband had set the downstairs on fire before he came up. (BEAT) (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And as I was slamming his head into the wall, trying to get shed of him, I could see clear as anything that it was all my fault. If I'd just never spoke to her.. (BEAT) And as I was thinking about that, I saw that the lamp he threw had set the room we were in on fire too. Bush forces himself to keep looking into Mattie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And then I realized that I was on fire. I tried to put myself out but I couldn't, everything was.. (BEAT) I dropped him, turned around and saw her lying on the floor and called her name. She looked up at me.. (BEAT) .and the next thing I knew, I was flying.. A loud roar of fire and crushing timbers..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BURNING HOUSE - NIGHT 163 A man on fire bursts through the second story window of a burning house. He lands hard and rolls across the yard to smother the flames. With his clothes still smoking, he unbelievably tries to run back into the hell. But the fire is too hot and he cannot. He screams like a mad man and runs into the trees..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BUSH'S LAND/FIELD - DAY 164 The crowd is motionless. Nothing is moving. It is as if the whole world has stopped. Frank, Buddy, and Kathryn are frozen. Bush and Mattie are looking into each other, one anguished soul to another.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know how I got out the window. (BEAT) (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No matter how many times I play it in my mind, I can't remember jumping. I thought I killed him, but maybe he pushed me, I don't know... (lost as ever..) I swear to you, if I left her in there.. everything I know about myself is a lie. But that don't matter. (BEAT) I didn't get her out, Little Bit, I didn't. I'm sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BUSH'S SHACK - DAY 165 Bush sits on the edge his bed. His face is drawn and haunted. The door open and closes. He doesn't look up. Mattie sits down beside him. Tears are streaming down her face. She lays her head gently on his shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, Felix.. He sniffs her hair and tenderly touches it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wonder if her hair would be white?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BUSH'S LAND/FIELD - END OF DAY/MONTAGE 166 A MAN chooses a winning raffle ticket from a wire cage. A poor YOUNG COUPLE with SEVERAL CHILDREN win the raffle! The promise of a new and better life begins for them. The big funeral party breaks up people wind their way home. The big old honking generator coughs off. Mule is lead back to the barn. The equipment is disassembled and loaded back on the truck. The microphone stands alone on the stage. He got it said.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BUSH'S SHACK - DAY 167 Buddy, Frank, Horton, Charlie, and Kathryn and the baby wait outside, giving Bush and Mattie time. Buddy takes the baby and holds it close.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Finally Mattie and Bush come out of the shack and walk down to the others. No one knows what to say. Finally..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How you doing, sir?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just fair, son.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carl said Ray paid them to set the fire. Paid them to break into the funeral home too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can't stop pulling Aces out of his ass, can he?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Spend his money on lawyers now. You know how thrifty they are. Frank motions to Buddy and they go to Bush. Buddy is still holding the baby, Bush looks tenderly at Buddy and the baby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's his name?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Larry, Lawrence, after my dad, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He ain't gonna throw rocks at me, is he?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not if knows what's good for him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You boys did good. Real good. Let's settle up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We don't have to do that now. You get some rest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (a look/ then) Yeah. We'll come out tomorrow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bring my shirt back, I just got it broke in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Bush pulls Buddy aside. Frank stares over at them but can't hear what they are saying. He moves over beside Mattie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you alright, Mattie? She looks up at Frank for a long moment, her face softening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, I don't know. I'm still moving, I guess.. He doesn't know what that means but she has finally really looked at him and that's something he'll hold onto. Kathryn comes and hugs Mattie as.. Bush and Buddy come back. Bush goes to Charlie. Frank is staring at Buddy, looking for a clue as to what Bush said. Buddy gives him nothing,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks again for coming, Charlie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm proud of you. (MEANING IT) Thank you for my church.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you ever get my bill?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can we get a ride our car's about 2 miles down the road. Everyone piles into the hearse. There is no back seat so they all have to crawl in the back door and sit along the sides. It makes everyone smile. Mattie gives Bush one last fleeting embrace then climbs in. Bush looks in on them all for a long moment all then closes the door. As the hearse moves out, he waves to Buddy who is looking out the back window. Buddy waves back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look at that. My funeral and everybody's in there but me. The hearse pulls onto the road and drives away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The place is suddenly quiet and beautiful. He looks down the road through the fading dust and sees a WOMAN walking slowly toward him. He squints, recognizes her, and his face fills with a timeless love.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BUSH'S LAND - DAY - TWO MONTHS LATER 168 It's a cold day beneath the spreading pecan tree. Mule stands hitched to the wagon. The three dog grave markers are frosted. A fourth grave marker just like the others leans against the tree. It is freshly carved with: Felix Elijah Bush. A pot of fresh yellow flowers sit beside the marker. Bush's beautiful handmade casket is inside his grave. Frank, Mattie, Charlie, Buddy, Kathryn, and Horton stand beside the grave. Several MEN with shovels wait near the tree. Charlie's eulogy is more of a one-sided conversation which Bush would probably love.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, Felix, this one's for real, I guess. I didn't actually see them put you in the box so.. Charlie glances over and notices "Charlie" on one of the dog's grave markers. He snorts and shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wherever you are, you're probably giving someone a hard time or something wonderful and priceless just to confuse them. Not everything can be figured out, nor everybody. I wish you peace from the burdens of your mind and heart. I wish it for us all. Mattie moves toward the edge of the grave. Frank puts a hand out to catch her should she should stumble. She stares down at the FB on the coffin, opens her hand, and lets the picture of her sister drift down onto the coffin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HILLSIDE - LATER 169 Everyone moves away as the men fill in the grave. Buddy and Kathryn move up beside Frank and Mattie and Charlie. Buddy tosses the ball of hermit money to Frank.
direction.name: direction
